This is not the usual white or black carrot cake, but a little more special with added ingredients. We were surprised to find bean sprouts and sweet onions. Nicely fried and tasty. The oyster omelette is not bad too. We appreciate that all are not too oily. Shiok. All good except they didnâ€™t include any chili sauce for the omelette. Will try the Hokkien mee another time.
Reminiscent of the previous store, love the pork lard and the ikan bills. Chilli changed to the spicy variety instead of sweet but still as good to me. Probably one of the best in the vicinity.
Similar to the original stall. But the feels somehow isnâ€™t the same. Would probably give 3.5stars if I could.
I like this place. Solid hokkien mee and char kway teow and the auntie is quite nice. Price is what you'd expect for this kind of food and never a long wait.
